DataElement.preferredDefinition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Vital Signs Domain Heart Rate Vital Signs Position
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to vital sign._The number of heartbeats per unit of time, usually expressed as beats per minute._The physical bearing of the body during a vital signs assessment.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC CDASH Vital Signs Position of Subject Terminology Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A terminology subset of the CDISC Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) Position codelist created for Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization (CDASH) Vital Signs Position of Subject terminology._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A posterior recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its back and faces upward.

Concepts.definition: A posterior recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its back and faces upward.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of assuming or maintaining an erect upright position.

Concepts.definition: The act of assuming or maintaining an erect upright position.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The state or act of one who sits; the posture of one who occupies a seat.

Concepts.definition: The state or act of one who sits; the posture of one who occupies a seat.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the position of the
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the position of the subject during the heart rate measurement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC CDASH Vital Signs Position of Subject Terminology
ReferenceDocuments.description: A terminology subset of the CDISC Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) Position codelist created for Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization (CDASH) Vital Signs Position of Subject terminology.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the position of subject at time of test (e.g. SITTING).

ReferenceDocuments.name: VSPOS
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Results may be affected by whether conditions for vital signs as specified in the protocol were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position. If the protocol requires this type of information, then a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSPOS may be created for each VSTESTCD and added to the CRF, if needed.
